parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rusting of steel brake lines can cause brake system failure, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Sudden loss of brake function
brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake fluid leaks
rust or corrosion visible on brake lines.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Warped brake rotors can cause brake failure, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Vibrations or pulsations when applying the brakes
brake pedal feels soft or spongy
uneven brake wear
grinding or scraping noises when braking.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake failure can cause a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Sudden loss of brake function
brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake fluid leaks
unusual noises or vibrations when braking.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Dual Fuel Pump Failure and Recall Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the dual fuel pumps can cause gasoline to leak onto the ground, creating a fire hazard and potential environmental damage. Additionally, recall repairs being refused or delayed due to part unavailability can leave the vehicle in an unsafe condition.
symptoms: Gasoline leaks from the rear tank to the front tank and onto the ground
difficulty getting recall work performed
recall repairs refused due to being out of warranty
part unavailability.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The improper aim of the headlights can cause glare to oncoming traffic, potentially leading to accidents or near-misses due to reduced visibility.
symptoms: Headlights are aimed too high
causing glare to oncoming traffic
difficulty seeing the road ahead
or complaints from other drivers about being blinded by the headlights.
